basic_info.description: My name is Vitaliy Vekslyer. I am an aspiring engineer enrolled in Engineering Physics @ SFU. I am always looking for new projects to work on and to gain experience from.

projects.title: Computer Vision-powered Visual Sepsis Detector
projects.description: Undergraduate research project of a computer-powered microscope for classification of sepsis-inducing bacteria using computer vision. I was the lead of the engineering team and had integrated a team of mechanical, electrical, computer and biomedical engineering students to create an actuator-powered automated microscope that moves around in an XY-axis to take pictures of a sample and then applies a deep learning model to classify different bacteria and assess a patient's risk of developing sepsis. This project is still ongoing as of July 2023, the device is ready but we require far more data for our model. I had worked closely with the CMOS image sensor, optics, and image processing of the device. Entire project was made in Simulink and MATLAB with use of Simscape to integrate together all mechanical, electrical and computer systems.

projects.title: Brain Computer Interface
projects.description:
I used OpenBCI's API and Machine Learning to control games made in Unity and PyGame.
 • Used OpenBCI API and neuromore to allow user to control a car game in Unity.
 • Implemented a machine learning inspired perceptron model to understand when user wishes to move the car forward.
 • Achieved 98% accuracy of user's intention to move the car.

projects.title: Asteroid Blaster
projects.description:
Asteroids clone made with C++ SDL. I wanted to know how games in C++ as well as GUIs are really being made and I came across SDL which I learnt a lot about while making this and a few other simple games.
 • Made using object-oriented principles.
 • Used knowledge of physics, algebra, trigonometry to implement simple 2D sprite movement.

projects.title: Exercise Journal
projects.description: The biggest collaborative project I had with seven other student developers. I delegated tasks using Agile PM principles and had worked closely with the frontend of the app with authentication of new users through the welcome screen.
